GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1859 as the only Norwegian agricultural post-graduate college. Renamed Agricultural University of Norway. Acquired present status and title 2005. Under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Education and Research since 1997. Merger with the Norwegian School of Veterinary Science (Norges Veterinaerhogskole) 2014
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as Bergen Museum 1825, became University 1946. A State institution with a high international profile that emphasises basic research, research-based teaching and the development of academic disciplines. Financed by a grant voted by Parliament
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (examen artium) or recognized equivalent

Divisions.College: Intervention Science in Maternal and Child Health

Divisions.Details: Nonsists of the former Bergen Academy of Art and Design and The Grieg Academy.

Divisions.College: Centre for Research-based Innovation in Sustainable Fishing and Pre-processing technology (CRISP)

Divisions.Details:
KG Jebsens Centre for Diabetes Research
KG Jebsens Centre for Research on Neuropsyciatric Disorders
KG Jebsens Centre for MS Research
KG Jebsens Brain Tumour Research Centre

Divisions.College: The Michelsen Centre for Industrial Measurement Science and Technology (MIMT)

GeneralInformation.History: Established in 2017 as Inland Norway University of Applied Sciences (Høgskoleni Innlandet) following merger between Lillehammer University College (Høgskolen i Lillehammer) and Hedmark University College (Høgskolen i Hedmark). Acquired current title and status 2024.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (examen artium); Admissions examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1811 as Kongelige Frederiks Universitet (Royal Frederick University). Restructure. Implements the Quality Reform, program structures, grade systems and exams are reshaped entirely in 2003
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate or recognized equivalent

Address.college_name: Western Norway University of Applied Sciences

GeneralInformation.History: Formed through a merger between Bergen University College, Sogn og Fjordane University College and Stord/Haugesund University College on January 1 2017
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (examen artium); Bergen test (Norwegian language)

GeneralInformation.History: Established in Bergen in 1986 as an educational alternative to the two public architecture schools in Norway. Approved by the Ministry of Education in 1990
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (examen artium); Proficiency in Norwegian language for first-level undergraduate admissions

GeneralInformation.History: Established as a limited company in 1943. Restructured and earned approval from the Ministry of Education in 1995. Earned accreditation as a scientific university in 2008

Established as Westerdals - Oslo School of Arts, Communication and Technology (Westerdals Oslo ACT) in 2014. Acquired current title and status following merger with Høyskolen Kristiania in 2017. A member of the European University Association since April 2019
Founded as the first Norwegian college to offer a degree in nursing in 1868

Address.college_name: Molde University College - Specialized University in Logistics
Address.university_name: Høgskolen i Molde - Vitenskapelig høgskole i logistikk – Molde Nursing School; Molde Regional College (HiMolde)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1994 following the merger of Molde Nursing School, founded in 1958, and Molde Regional College, founded in 1969
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: August to May (August - December; January - May)
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (examen artium); Entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Established in 1995. Earned initial accreditation in 2006. Acquired present status following institutional merger with Hauge School of Management in 2013

Founded as Høgskolen i Bodø in 1994. Became Universitetet i Nordland (University of Nordland) in 2010. Acquired current accreditation status and title in 2016, following the merger of (Høgskolen i Nord-Trøndelag) Nord-Trøndelag University College and Høgskolen i Nesna (Nesna University College)
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: August to December; January to June
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (examen artium); Certificate of English language proficiency

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1973. A State Institution
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (examen artium); Admissions audtion; Entrance examination; Demonstrated proficiency in English or Norwegian

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 2002
Established in 1920. Earned national accreditation in 2004
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate; Driving license class B; Medical examination; Background check; Norwegian citizenship

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as a result of efforts from the Bergen business community in 1936
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1968. A State Institution financially supported by the Ministry of Education and Research
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (examen artium); Physical fitness examination

Address.college_name: Norwegian School of Theology, Religion and Society
Address.university_name: MF vitenskapelig høyskole for teologi, religion og samfunn

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1907 as an independent theological institution at university level and is Norway's largest provider of theological education and research

Address.college_name: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1910 as Norwegian Institute of Technology. Part of University of Trondheim in 1968. Merger in 1996 including the College of Arts and Science, and the Natural History and Archaeology Museum. Merged with Høgskolen i Ålesund (Ålesund University College), Høgskolen i Gjøvik (Gjøvik University College) and Høgskolen i Sør-Trøndelag (Sør-Trøndelag University College) in 2016
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate

Divisions.College: Information Technology, Mathematics and Electrical Engineering

Address.college_name: Oslo National Academy of the Arts

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as National College of Art and Design in 1818. Acquired present name and status in 1996, Following the merger of five formerly independent colleges. It is now a University College
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (examen artium); Entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1994. Became Høgskolen i Oslo og Akershus (Oslo and Akershus University College of Applied Sciences) in 2011 following the merger between Høgskolen i Oslo (Oslo University College) and Høgskolen i Akershus (Akershus University College). Acquired current title and status in 2018
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate

Address.college_name: Queen Maud University College of Early Childhood Education
Address.university_name: Dronning Mauds Minne Høgskole for barnehagelærerutdanning

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1947 to provide education to early childhood education teachers. Acquired present status in 2008
Founded in 1981
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate; Vocational training; Background check

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1989. The SUAS and Sámi Institute were merged in 2005. Provides education with an emphasis on indigenous culture and practices

Address.college_name: The Oslo School of Architecture and Design

GeneralInformation.History: The School of Architecture was established in 1945 as a crisis course for students who had their education canceled by World War II. Acquired present title in 2005. Established Landscape Architecture Masters program in 2004
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Vitnemål fra videregående skole); Entrance examination

Address.college_name: UiT The Arctic University of Norway

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1968, officially opened by King Olav V 1972. A State institution enjoying considerable autonomy in both academic and financial matters. Financed primarily by the government. Merged with Tromso University College 2009. Formerly known as University of Tromsø until merger with the University College of Finmark 2013, then merged with Narvik University College (Høgskolen i Narvik) and Harstad University College (Høgskolen i Harstad) in 2016
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (examen artium) or recognized equivalent

Address.university_name: Universitetet i Agder – Agder College; Agder University College (UiA)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as Agder University College in 1994. Acquired present status and title in 2007

Founded as Høgskolen i Buskerud og Vestfold (Buskerud and Vestfold University College) in 2014 after the merger of Buskerud University College (Høgskolen i Buskerud) and Vestfold University College (Høgskolen i Vestfold). Became Høgskolen i Sørøst-Norge (University College of Southeast Norway) in 2016 after a further merger with Høgskolen i Telemark (Telemark University College). Acquired current title and status in 2018
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate: Certificate of English language proficiency; Admissions qualifications specific to programme requirements

Divisions.College: Technology, Natural Sciences and Maritime Sciences

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as Stavanger University College in 1994. Acquired official university status in 2005

Established on January 1, 2016, from the merger between four Norwegian institutions: Diakonhjemmet University College, Haraldsplass Deaconess University College, Betanien University College and School of Mission and Theology
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (examen artium)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1994 from the merger of Møre og Romsdal regional college and the Volda Teachers College
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school leaving certicate

Address.university_name: Høgskolen i Østfold – Østfold nursing college; Halden teacher training college; Østfold college of engineering; Østfold regional college and Østfold social educator college. (HIØ)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1994, following the merger of Østfold nursing college, Halden teacher training college, Østfold college of engineering, Østfold regional college and Østfold social educator college
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate or recognized equivalent
